alert.note: Alert for Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 19 at 5:31PM CDT until April 19 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR WESTERN WILL COUNTY... At 530 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Shorewood, or near Plainfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. This storm recently produced ping pong size hail in Plattville, and continues to intensify. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Aurora, Joliet, Naperville, Bolingbrook, Orland Park, Romeoville, Plainfield, Woodridge, Lockport, New Lenox, Homer Glen, Mokena, Frankfort, Channahon, Minooka, Crest Hill, Shorewood, Manhattan, Ingalls Park and Elwood. This includes... University of St. Francis, Channahon State Park, Chicagoland Speedway...Route 66 Raceway, Joliet Junior College, Joliet Slammers Baseball, and Lewis University. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 243 and 269. I-80 between mile markers 123 and 143. I-355 between mile markers 1 and 7, and between mile markers 11 and 14. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
